required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Drug Levels of BMS-986337 When Taken by Mouth by Healthy Participants
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Randomized, Single and Multiple Ascending Dose Study of the Safety and Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics (Including Food Effect, pH Effect and Japanese Bridging Study) of BMS-986337 Following Oral Administration in Healthy Participants

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and drug levels of BMS-986337 in healthy participants and in healthy Japanese participants.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of AEs leading to discontinuation
Number of clinically significant changes in clinical laboratory values: Hematology tests
Number of clinically significant changes in clinical laboratory values: Urinalysis tests
Number of clinically significant changes in clinical laboratory values: Clinical chemistry tests
Number of clinically significant changes from baseline in vital signs: Heart Rate
Number of clinically significant changes from baseline in vital signs: Body Temperature
Number of clinically significant changes from baseline in vital signs: Blood Pressure
Number of clinically significant changes from baseline in vital signs: Respiratory Rate
Number of clinically significant changes in electrocardiogram (ECG) parameters: Heart rate (HR)
Number of clinically significant changes from baseline in physical examinations
Number of clinically significant changes in ECG parameters: PR interval
primary_outcome.description: PR interval is the time from the onset of the P wave to the start of the QRS complex

primary_outcome.measure: Number of clinically significant changes in ECG parameters: QRS duration
primary_outcome.description: QRS can be defined as the electrical impulse as it spreads through the ventricles, indicating ventricular depolarization

primary_outcome.measure: Number of clinically significant changes in ECG parameters: QTc-interval (Fridericia's)
primary_outcome.description: QTcF = Corrected QT interval using the Fridericia formula. QT interval is the time from the start of the Q wave to the end of the T wave.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of clinically significant changes in ECG parameters: QT interval
primary_outcome.description: The QT interval is the time from the start of the Q wave to the end of the T wave.

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding Bristol-Myers Squibb Clinical Trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com.
Inclusion Criteria:
- No clinically significant deviation from normal in medical history, physical examination, electrocardiograms (ECGs), and clinical laboratory determinations
- For Japanese cohorts in Part C, must be first-generation Japanese (born in Japan, not living outside of Japan for more than 10 years, and both parents are ethnically Japanese)
- Body mass index (BMI) of 18.0 kg/m^2 to 30.0 kg/m^2, inclusive, at screening; BMI = weight (kg)/height (m)^2
- Women and men must agree to follow specific methods of contraception, if applicable
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are of childbearing potential
- Women who are breastfeeding
- Prior exposure to BMS-986278
- Positive nasopharyngeal reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) test for severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) on Day -2
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria apply
